column4: hi is there an internet browser that is less cpu heavy than firefox?
anyone use xfce on ubuntu? is it really lighter like they say? last time i used it i had a lot of package conflicts i didn't know how to fix
lately my laptop has been overheating due to azurues and virtualbox running and it never happened before so i am wondering what is going on
it is lighter, but I wonder how much more....anyway there is also LXDE you can try...which is truly lighter
how do you know that it is due to those two applications?
lappy just shuts down all on its own?
what model/make of computer and approximate age?
hp laptop dv6768se 1 year
is this a ubuntu only pc.....or do you have windows dual boot?
ubuntu only
when i run virtualbox and azureus it gets screwed up i installed madwifi customized driver before when the net signal went out it would overheat and shutdown also

okay.  I was wondering if the problem occured on windows side at all....but you only have ubuntu.  What about if you boot from livecd....do you still get the same thing happening?  Also, you could try the virtualbox channel for help...maybe they know if there is an issue....also are u running latest version of vbox and azareus??

it would happen also when i was running Transmission but i think it is a network card driver issue with wifi when i use ethernet cable it doesn't happen like before like i said now it just gets really hot and shuts off
yes i am
could it be any problem with the fact i have an amd64 processor and am runnnig i386 ubuntu and packages?
that is what was advised to me before
to run i386 due to compatability issues
hmm...that is a good question.  Again, I would try the vbox channel.  Guy names erstazi is particularly knowledgable and helpful if he is on
I think you may be onto something....with fact with the 32 bit packages under 64 bit
do you think that was good advice?
when i was using amd 64 before the packages were not being compatible
I have not bit the 64bit bullet yet.  And I am wary of it ...but others say all is good.  Who knows?
